title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Statement of David Fultz, February 8, 1867
summary: Fultz, a lawyer in Staunton, offers a statement about his acquaintance with Frederick Tukey. Fultz states that he had the confidence of the local black population, and would therefore have known about any complaints against Tukey, of which, he says, there were none.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Legal System, American Civil War
